intro: Phyllorkis variphylis, commonly known as the variable leaf phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from narrow to broad, depending on environmental conditions. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying white or pale pink hues. Phyllorkis variphylis is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands.
